oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Case Control Investigation of Neospora Seroprevalence and Risk Factor Analysis for Infection and Associated Abortion in Ontario Holstein Dairy Herds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hobson, J.
Duffield, T.
Peregrine, A.
McEwen, B.
Hietala, S.
Cramer, G.
Cochran, M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Neospora caninum
abortion
risk factors
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In the last 10 years Neospora caninum has been identified as a major cause of abortion in dairy cattle worldwide. The objectives of this study were to characterize the impact of N. caninum infection on production and health in Ontario Holstein dairy herds and to identify possible risk factors for N. caninum serostatus and related abortions.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2000; 149
